Romans__05.1: Being justified therefore by faith, let us have peace with God, through our Lord Jesus Christ:
Romans__05.2: By whom also we have access through faith into this grace, wherein we stand, and glory in the hope of the glory of the sons of God.
Romans__05.3: And not only so; but we glory also in tribulations, knowing that tribulation worketh patience;
Romans__05.4: And patience trial; and trial hope;
Romans__05.5: And hope confoundeth not: because the charity of God is poured forth in our hearts, by the Holy Ghost, who is given to us.
Romans__05.6: For why did Christ, when as yet we were weak, according to the time, die for the ungodly?
Romans__05.7: For scarce for a just man will one die; yet perhaps for a good man some one would dare to die.
Romans__05.8: But God commendeth his charity towards us; because when as yet we were sinners, according to the time,
Romans__05.9: Christ died for us; much more therefore, being now justified by his blood, shall we be saved from wrath through him.
Romans__05.10: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son; much more, being reconciled, shall we be saved by his life.
Romans__05.11: And not only so; but also we glory in God, through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received reconciliation.
Romans__05.12: Wherefore as <u>by one man</u> sin entered into this world, and by sin death; and so death passed upon all men, in whom all have sinned.
Romans__05.13: For until the law sin was in the world; but sin was <u>not imputed</u>, when the law was not.
Romans__05.14: But death reigned from Adam unto Moses, even over them also who have not sinned after the similitude of the transgression of Adam, who is a figure of him who was to come.
Romans__05.15: But not as the offence, so also the gift. For if by the offence of one, many died; much more the grace of God, and the gift, by the grace of one man, Jesus Christ, hath abounded unto many.
Romans__05.16: And not as it was by one sin, so also is the gift. For judgment indeed was by one unto condemnation; but grace is of many offences, unto justification.
Romans__05.17: For if by one man's offence death reigned through one; much more they who receive abundance of grace, and of the gift, and of justice, shall reign in life through one, Jesus Christ.
Romans__05.18: Therefore, as by the offence of one, unto all men to condemnation; so also by the justice of one, unto all men to justification of life.
Romans__05.19: For as by the disobedience of one man, many were made sinners; so also by the obedience of one, many shall be made just.
Romans__05.20: Now the law entered in, <u>that sin might abound</u>. And where sin abounded, grace did more abound.
Romans__05.21: That as sin hath reigned to death; so also grace might reign by justice unto life everlasting, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
